website_summaries.verdict: Have coffee just like at home with this drip coffee maker designed to work on your camp-stove.
pros: Makes a good cup of coffee
Takes about 15 minutes to heat and brew the coffee
Filter drawer detaches for easy cleaning
Doesn't burn the coffee like many camp coffee makers
cons: The coffee pot is small and only brews about 4 cups at a time

customer_reviews.title: Constantly ran this bad boy while camping
customer_reviews.text: My life will never be the same. Constantly ran this bad boy while camping. I love it. Works just like the one at home (minus the fire you have to put under it) and cleans up easily for storage. Almost TOO civilized for camping! Takes up more space than my percolator did, but I lost a part for my perc and replacing it was not a lot less than buying this so I figured I'd give it a try. Can't imagine life before this now :)
customer_reviews.author: M. WUNDERLICH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for camping or power outages!
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT! This is our 2nd one. We love it for when there's a power outage or if we're camping without power. Unfortunately I broke the first one after using it for 2 years by not adding the water first one morning and burned up the elements. I only did so because I had not had my coffee first. Seriously, this coffee maker is the best. Just read the directions first.
customer_reviews.author: ARamblingRose

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee but needs to be handled right
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what i need for dry camping. It has two flaws - which i have found workarounds for. The first is that you have to make sure the plastic tab engages when you rotate the coffee basket into place. Otherwise the coffee does not flow to the carafe. The second is that it takes FOREVER to brew a pot of coffee. The workaround for that is to pre-heat the water in a regular coffee pot container. Once you learn these tricks you get good coffee! But that takes it down to 3 stars
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camping Coffeemaker.
customer_reviews.text: Love love love our Coleman Camping Coffee Maker!!! We are finally using during our 1st camping trip of the season and it brews coffee just like our coffee maker at home!!! Ba bye percolator, no more grinds in our coffee. Thanks Coleman, for yet another awesome & reliable product!!! Rosemary Burr
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: MELT DOWN!
customer_reviews.text: Camping with friends who have camped for over 20 years. I provided new equipment for the trip. Friend made coffee and coffee maker literally melted apart onto my brand new gas stove. Really disappointed... Not sure what else to say as the pics say it all. Friend said he had the temp set a little less than mid point for heat. Only stove and it was damaged. No nearby store, so we had to convert over to charcoal cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Steve CA

customer_reviews.title: Great for Camping, love this!
customer_reviews.text: I use it on a Coleman Roadtrip Grill. I take the grate off, as others had suggested, and place it over a medium-high flame. It is a bit tricky with the shape of the grill, but it works. We love to have our coffee while camping and this is so much quicker than the percolators on the grill. It makes wonderful coffee and when you order the case to put it in, super convenient to pack. I actually pack all of my coffee related items right in the bag with the maker (travel mugs, sugar, coffee, filters, tablespoon for measuring). Great purchase, especially at $29.99
customer_reviews.author: christine donohue

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was really looking forward to morning coffee while camping. Did not work well! Lid over coffee basket that also holds water tube would not stay shut ! Spraying water out top. Had to physically hold it shut. Then drip hole barely dripped coffee causing coffee basket to overflow anyway. Not well made ! No coffee . Tried again out of coffee withdrawal . Had to hold coffee basket lid on . Then had to manually open drip pause button open wider . After about 30 min of this did finally get coffee ! Not worth the headache and burns! Very disappointed in coleman!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be very patient for your coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a coffee maker that I didn't need to have power to make coffee. I can use this in my RV on the stove using propane. I think it takes 30 minutes to make a pot as I don't like to grab a cup at the beginning of brewing as it is able to do with the feature. It is simple to use except for you have to leave the pot out until the grounds are positioned and door is closed other wise the pot will interfere with the "pour a cup as it is brewing" valve and will overflow the grounds basket.
customer_reviews.author: Guy A Aiello

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love this product worked great. Only little problem is the pausing feature when removing the carafe (so coffee doesnt spill onto the area the carafe is kept warm. It is just a lever that prevents the water from flowing through the filter. You have to be careful it is in the proper position to allow pouring when you put the carafe in the first time otherwise the filter floods with water and grounds pour all over the place. Sounds kind of dumb but it happened twice on early morning hangovers.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Finally decent coffee while camping
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker works really well for camping. It works just like a traditional drip coffee maker you would use at home. Put the water in the back, coffee filter and ground coffee in the basket, and turn on the stove. As long as you have the stove level you will not get any coffee grounds in your coffee. It takes about 15 minutes to brew a full pot. It also has a pause and serve feature which I did not try.
customer_reviews.author: W K

customer_reviews.title: No more grounds
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker. Used the old perk cowboy coffee maker for years. Always got a mouthful of grounds. Not any more! The only drawback I see to this maker is you have to make sure that the little release valve to the coffee basket is engaged otherwise you will get a carrafe full of grounds. Not sure if this is a product flaw or I got a lemon. Not a big deal though, I just make sure the little release valve is engaged. Best to keep a seperate carrafe around to keep the coffee hot after brewed.
customer_reviews.author: Himey

customer_reviews.title: Great for Camping!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so that I can have fresh brewed coffee when we go camping. This past summer we went camping in Yosemite for a week and the coffee maker worked like a charm. I had one issue while using it and that was my problem not Coleman's...I did not put the coffee pot in correctly and so the coffee did not drip into the pot, instead it overflowed from the top. Lesson learned. I highly recommend this if you camp and have a gas stove to use it on.
customer_reviews.author: CCinNC

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t actually make coffee.
customer_reviews.text: So bummed...I was car camping for a few weeks and wanted an actual coffee maker. I used this with a Coleman stove just like the picture shows, but it basically just spilled water all over the place and the filter part filled up with water and grounds. I tried to fix it, and I think there was a plastic part that wasn’t going where it was supposed to. I never got it to work after several attempts.
customer_reviews.author: EBS

customer_reviews.title: Coffee into the carafe
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to see this for our beach camping trips. Arrived yesterday and I got it ready for my morning coffee. Got up this morning and turned the stove on and waited. Steam came out if the top and no coffee in the pot. Waited but still nothing. The basket was full of water. It would not drip. Out came my old Pyrex for this morning's coffee. It being returned when I get home.
customer_reviews.author: flamingomama

customer_reviews.title: Great to use in trailer before you want to start generators.
customer_reviews.text: When we used this the first time the water filled up the coffee filter area and was not draining properly into the carafe. We had to push the lever in the very back when putting carafe in or it doesn't work correctly. It is the lever that operates the "pause". Once we figured that out it works fine. Dumb design that the carafe itself doesn't push that in properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Stanger

customer_reviews.title: Great for the outdoors!
customer_reviews.text: Currently used this for Labor Day Camping, and I can say that this did not disappoint. This coffee pot was able to make coffee for 13 ppl. yes i had to make 2 pots. but, it was worth it. For a full pot of coffee, it takes about 10 mins to make on a medium flame. just make sure you keep an eye on the pot, or you can melt the plastic. Also to remember to clean it after use, so not to get any mold or bugs that might want to drink the sweet nectar of humans.
customer_reviews.author: KROD

customer_reviews.title: Fresh brewed, drip coffee in my RV, even when I'm out in the sticks!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I've bought - really like them. Fresh, drip coffee in the RV even when I'm out in the sticks and no shore power. The last one I had started to get rusty at the bottom, but it worked fine until we had the carafe handle pointed the wrong way and melted it. Was looking for a new carafe, but the cost of a whole new unit was only $10 more, so bought that instead. I will keep my eye open for a carafe at Goodwill so I can have the second unit as a spare.
customer_reviews.author: SteveO

customer_reviews.title: How easy it was to opperate.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time may 12th. It is great to have coffee of this calibur while you are out in the middle of know where with out electricity. I found if you don't have the flame up all the way it brews slower, but it is working. I found the setting that worked vest and marked it with a Sharpe on the knob. That helps when you are still half asleep and it is still dark out.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Baggetta

customer_reviews.title: I'm really pleased with the quality build of the coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Our power went out a little before 2 am this morning. I smiled to myself when I heard my husband pouring water into our electric coffee maker this morning. He quickly realized his mistake, though. Then I remembered that this little beauty had been delivered last week. We got it for our camper. I suggested we open it up and see how well it works on our kitchen gas stove. It takes a little longer to brew than our electric coffee maker but my husband is currently enjoying a fresh brewed cuppa Joe. I'm really pleased with the quality build of the coffee maker. The carafe is nice and doesn't dribble when being poured from.
customer_reviews.author: crc

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: The lever that dispenses coffee into the carafe (or pauses dispensing if you are pouring a coffee mid-brew) seems to be installed incorrectly. The coffee and grounds overflowed the back of the basket with no coffee in the carafe. I checked to see if the carafe was simply not properly depressing the lever but that was not the issue. When I swung the basket out (filled with scalding hot water and steaming grounds) I discovered that I had to pull down on the lever to get the coffee to dispense. Clearly that was never going to work. Such a disappointment -- there is nothing better than a hot coffee on a cold morning in camp. Returning :(.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Hansrn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the task -- just read the instructions!
customer_reviews.text: This product works exactly as promised; most negative reviews obviously are the result of user error. Read the instructions and follow them, use common sense, and this coffee maker will make you very happy. Ours has already supplied a five-day camping trip, and came through with flying colors. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: The Professor

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing ... Coleman Camping Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: On the first camping trip the top portion of the coffee maker came off after the fourth pot of coffee and would not go back on all of the way. I battled with water leaking down the side of the coffee maker and the top just setting on unit for three weeks on a camping trip. I would not recommend buying this product. It seemed of poor quality and took an extreme amount of time to perk. I purchased the unit about 6 months before using it, consequently I was not able to return the unit after actually using it only a few times. I now have an expensive brand new broken unit sitting on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: musselman

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my RV stove when "dry camping" It works great, It does take about 20 minutes to brew an full caraffe and I usually use 5 scoops of coffee in my brewer at home, but this really makes strong coffee, so I only use 4 scoops. I bought a second Coleman Coffe Maker to keep at our cabin. I'm anxious to see if it brews faster on a Coleman stove.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H.

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Coleman products
customer_reviews.text: This works great on my 1950 Coleman white gas stove. Just like a drip coffee maker at home. You do need a good stove to heat up the water quickly, but a white gas or propane stove should do the job just fine. Don't try this with an electric heating coil.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Works great with one hicup
customer_reviews.text: Works great on top of our pop up tent campers stove. There is one design flaw, that will get you if you don't understand how this works. If you fill the water 1st while the top is swung over and then place the carafe into position. This stops the spring from activating allowing the finished coffee to drop into the carafe. You need to take the carafe out and place it into position after the top is swung closed.
customer_reviews.author: Lewy

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I would never buy this again! Everytime I try using it the filter ends up overflowing with water and runs all over the place. Unfortately I ended up throwing it across my campsite and smashing it instead of just returning the piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for dry camping
customer_reviews.text: Worked great with our Coleman propane camp stove. Brew time was similar to an electric auto drip at home. Not sure what people were complaining about regarding it not filling the 10 cup carafe. As long as you slightly overfill the carafe with water to account for evaporation it works fine. I brewed multiple 10 cup pots with no issue. This is a great solution when camping without electricity.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Works great on the Coleman Grill
customer_reviews.text: Works great on the Coleman Grill. Coffee takes about 15 - 20 minutes to be 8 cups. Be sure to engage the drip stop lever when putting this together. I would rate it 5 stars but the drip stop lever is a small but critical design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: William Cole

customer_reviews.title: I used to take a french press but didn't like the cleanup of wet grounds
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait to take it camping. I've used percolators when camping, but prefer the taste of drip coffee. I used to take a french press but didn't like the cleanup of wet grounds. This drip coffee pot allows me to use my pop up's stove and allows me to throw away a filter with all the grounds without having a mess or wasting precious water when dry camping like we do.
customer_reviews.author: Nick L

customer_reviews.title: this coffee pot sucks
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this coffee pot based on some really high reviews and the fact that Coleman is such a reliable brand (usually). It sucks. Every pot of coffee has taken forever to brew, we have had to stop and reposition the basket because it was overflowing, and the coffee is not drinkable. It tastes like soap. We have done everything suggested to get rid of the taste and nothing has worked. Do not recommend this pot.
customer_reviews.author: Denise K. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Man, This Thing Works.
customer_reviews.text: I am no good without coffee in the morning, so having this as part of my camping kit is essential. My one caution is to be careful of the shut off control in the back, it sometimes doesn't get above the flow valve when you close the basket. It's really tough to reposition it when hot, and it pops off a bit too easily. Otherwise, awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the RV!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker works like a regular electric drip coffee maker except on the stovetop! We use it in our RV. It does take a little longer though. Maybe 15-20 minutes? I just set it up the night before and turn on the burner under it while I get dressed and make breakfast. Perfect for the boondock RVer!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great option for preparing coffee while camping.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is simple and great to use when camping. The brewing process (for 8-10 cups) takes a good 15 minutes or so. It seems sturdy and makes as good of coffee as our electric coffee maker at home. Definitely a good investment if you want to have multiple cups of coffee and have no electrical power source.
customer_reviews.author: JRHoly

customer_reviews.title: Just learn how the pour in midbrew feature actually works. It’s not a bad design, very reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I found a Korean stainless steel teapot on eBay so I won’t risk breathing the glass carafe in my camper.Coleman no longer carries the stainless quikpot. I just brewed my first pot and am so excited to use this when actually camping. It makes better coffee than my electric drip machine. I can’t speak highly enough of this coffee maker!
customer_reviews.author: Luke A Glazar

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee maker for my RV propane cook stove!
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed at how well this works. I have been using it in my travel trailer and it is nearly as fast as an electric coffee maker. I use this coffee maker when I don't have full time electricity and the coffee tastes great! I am so happy that I found this product. Recommend to anyone looking for a drip coffee maker that you can use on your RV propane cooktop. (You just have to remove the covers and center it above the burners for an even temperature and be sure and turn off the stove as soon as it finishes making the coffee.)
customer_reviews.author: kwhitw

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Worked great once you get it started and dropping okay. The pot has to be lined up just right or it won't drip and the basket will overflow. Once you get the hang of it (the second time), its quick, easy, and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Just like home
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Tried it out before our camping trip this week and it worked just like our dripmaker at home. Rather large for car camping but worth making room in the car. First pot arrived damaged (metal bottom on one corner was greatly dented) but Amazon responded quickly by shipping a new one and had UPS pickup the damaged one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kleine

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to our camping gear! We had to remove the little piece that allows you to grab a cup while brewing as it’s placement seemed off and Caused the coffee to stop dripping. Once we did that we were happy campers...literally!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaked all over my camper counter
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for a camping trip to the Adirondack mountains. Our camper has a 3 burner stove so we placed it over one of the burners. Once the water inside started to boil, it poured out the bottom section of the coffee maker. Thinking that we may have done it wrong, we moved it to the camp fire and again had the same results! This was a huge let-down as we were not smart enough to test it out ahead of time. I'll be sending it back to Coleman even if I have to take a loss.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Stevens

customer_reviews.title: If you like good coffee fast or have a big group of coffee drinkers on your camping trip, don't miss this little gem
customer_reviews.text: For anyone whose suffered from coffee withdrawls while car camping and waiting for a french press to serve up your morning dose of vitamin-C, this baby is for you! This little jimmy was the hit of our beach camping trip this year; 10 cups of drip joe in no time! Also, love the shutoff valve such that you can grab that first cup before the brewing cycle is complete without spillage. Like your home drip maker, just powered by a burner on your stove. Best $40 bucks I've spent on camping gear in some time, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Troy D. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Stays in Filter Basket
customer_reviews.text: I will be returning this since I attempted to make coffee with it twice and both times the majority of the coffee stayed in the filter basket rather than dripping into the decanter. Also, coffee leaks out of the top of the filter basket due to it being too full. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! We used it while camping this summer. It worked very well over the burner on the camp stove. Makes really good coffee. This was the best purchase we made for our family reunion!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Great product for camping
customer_reviews.text: Great product for camping. Did try on a stove in an RV and did not have the same results as using on my Coleman. (Note: the rv is not mine and I don't consider using and rv actual camping. lol) Works perfectly on the outdoor Coleman or like stoves. Make sure the metal plate covers the flame or you may melt the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Chin

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Work great I read the reviews saying it has to be level to use but did not find this to be true brewed 8 pots the first camping trip and I did find that it has to have filter basket put in first or it won't activate the first pour function and will not allow it to drip into coffe pot and then will overflow.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee slowly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 2 week car camping trip. It is large and will take up space in the car. It makes great coffee but it is slow. A french press probably is the way to go for camp coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Mt Spurr

customer_reviews.title: Works great in the RV
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee maker while boondocking or camping without hookups or a generator. Make sure you close the basket before placing the coffee pot as others noted. Keep a medium size flame to brew normally. Turn off heat when done. Enjoyed fresh hot coffee waking up to the typical drip brewing noise so many coffee lovers love to hear. Fits great on top of a three burner RV “Magic Chef” stove using the front “high speed” burner set to a middle sized flame (note, observe the flame size itself, not the setting on the stove). Yum
customer_reviews.author: Marcus J

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Received product just after Hurricane Irma on day 3 of a 7 day power outage. Was a life saver. I could make coffee on my coleman camp stove. no power, but I could make coffee, made life bearable.lol. Quality is good and functioned just like it was suppose to.,
customer_reviews.author: chick richards

customer_reviews.title: Coffee won't drain from basket, simply overflows
customer_reviews.text: maybe someone can help. the pot basket doesnt trigger the pour now function. or more accurately, doesnt allow the basket to drain into the pot. the two don't meet. so before i disassemble it completely, can someone tell me what i'm doing wrong? it's not a clog issue, if i manually depress the basket lever it flows.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Decent.
customer_reviews.text: It works. The top cover didn’t fit quite right and it had a dent in the thin metal part. Probably should have sent it back but it seemed to do what it was supposed to. I expected better quality from Coleman and their not even the best anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle D. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't have stayed sane without it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for camping obviously, and it was awesome. Easy to use, and makes good coffee. It takes a little longer than an electric coffee maker, obviously, since you're cooking over a flame, but it was worth the extra time to have drip coffee while camping. This is by far my favorite camping item now.
customer_reviews.author: Selina Mularz

customer_reviews.title: awesome coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker worked great we do a lot of dry camping with our trailer although I have a generator I don't like to bother my camping neighbors with my generator so early in the morning just to brew a cup of coffee that's where this coffee maker comes in I can simply turn my burner on and wait approximately 15 minutes and I have a great tasting pot of coffee you can't tell the difference versus a standard drip coffee maker I highly recommend this great product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: My first one worked great just as this one does
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of this model. My first one worked great just as this one does. Word of advice when using a camp stove with wind guards is keep it all the way against the wind guard or give it a good amount of room, if there is a gap the heat will rise up between the gap and melt the plastic, oops. It makes coffee pretty quick and I love how it's just like making coffee at home as I can't use a percolator to save my life.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Handle Melted on first use
customer_reviews.text: Stamped into the metal, so you can't see it, it says to keep the handle centered. So just remember, in your pre-coffee fog... KEEP that handle CENTERED, or it will melt...!!!
customer_reviews.author: WildWomanOnAHorse

customer_reviews.title: Coffee pot good for camping trips
customer_reviews.text: It arrived just in time for our camping trip which was good. We opened up the box, set up the pot to use and the basket wouldn't stay shut. The plastic may have bent or buckled in the shipping perhaps or was just defective. So we put a rubber band around the entire unit to keep it shut so we could make coffee when we had no electric hook-ups. By the time the trip was over the plastic that had been misshapen actually was corrected by the pressure of the rubber band. At any rate, aside from this, the coffee pot made good coffee and is useful for camping trips where there is no electric hook-ups.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Sangster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in my Off Grid Hone
customer_reviews.text: We are off grid and previously used a metal percolator for over 12 years. This product works great on our propane stove, we have coffee in half the time and it tastes fantastic. Our burner can be very low and we can leave it on 2 hours with no problem. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of Bride

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: We used our coffee maker for the first time over this past weekend at a dry campground. It takes a bit longer to brew and, although my husband filled it to 12 cups, it actually only brewed about 8. Still, the coffee tasted great and it sure beat instant.
customer_reviews.author: janfTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Works great over my propane stove.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to speed up making coffee in my camp trailer. Works great. I'm giving it 4 stars because after 1 month the top plastic cover came loose and popped off. It never fit the same after that. It does still function and that is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first, but then slowed way down.....
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this Coleman Coffee maker it was awesome! After that it seems to get slower each time I make a pot of coffee, and I've had one episode where I couldn't close the basket door for some reason -- it kept pushing itself back out, and not locking properly with the carafe safety mechanism. I've seen a bunch of people here complain about these issues now, so I'll plan to work around these issues in the future. Not sure why it is so slow to brew though? A pot of coffee took 25 minutes last trip!
customer_reviews.author: Carlton Davenport

customer_reviews.title: "WHEN THE VALVE DOES NOT OPEN YOU GET COFFEE ALL OVER THE STOVE"
customer_reviews.text: TO MAKE COFFEE!..THE COFFEE IS GOING TO SPILL OVER OUT OF THE BASKET BECAUSE RELEASE LEVER IS NOT OPENING THE VALVE TO LET THE COFFEE GO INTO THE DECANTER, SOMETHING IS MISSING ?
customer_reviews.author: Julian F Blair

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our little camper
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our little camper. Takes longer than a traditional electric coffee pot, about 15 minutes for a full 12 cups but it tastes like home and isn't as messy as presses or percolators. A new staple in our camper. Using proper flame control it will work with our gas stove or butane stove at home during power outages too. Just be patient and don't use power boil settings!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: It makes coffee, but.
customer_reviews.text: This machine makes a decent pot of coffee, but it is slower than slow. I like to fill my travel mug and go for a morning hike on my camping trips, but I hate waiting on this thing. The thing is, I can't find a better alternative. So I guess this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty dang cool once you figure out how to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty dang cool once you figure out how to use it. We were lucky to have a small gas stove in our cabin, so it worked fine. Didn't work on our Coleman grill, would be nearly impossible to use over camp fire with serious rigging. Makes decent coffee, but don't be hurried for it...you'll be waiting
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Larson

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome and works like a charm! No more grounds in your coffee from using that pesky percolator! One thing to remember is to return the pot to the burner as the last step and keep the handle centered, otherwise it may not shut properly. I would recommend this product for anyone camping without power. It works just like your regular coffee pot, only takes a little longer to brew.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Enriquez

customer_reviews.title: Very good camping coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: Use this coffee maker on camping trips. Works best on a two burner stove with a grate. Makes coffee just like at home.
customer_reviews.author: DenM

customer_reviews.title: Don't use with paper filters!
customer_reviews.text: Age old problem with "Mr Coffee" type brewers- keeping the filter upright. Must use gold baskets to avoid that problem. I will just get a Keurig and plug in or start the onboard generator in the RV. I burnt my hand trying to move this off the stove before it spilled into it. I failed miserably and got coffee grounds everywhere. Don't use with paper filters!
customer_reviews.author: Mark P Walker

customer_reviews.title: Remember to turn it off
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second one. It works great, if a bit slowly. You have to turn it off as soon as it is done, or the aluminum bottom will deform, it will stop working as the coil will not properly contact the bottom to pick up heat. Tricky or impossible to repair that. I'm using it in a stationary trailer, not sure I would want to take it camping as it's a bit bulky and has a glass carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Flymo

customer_reviews.title: Great Camping Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: Makes awesome coffee easy in the morning. Simple set up and cleanup. The unit consists of metal parts in the lower section near the heat source and plastic parts in the upper section where the basket and coffee filters are. I noticed no problem with the unit getting very hot. I used a Coleman propane stove as the heatsource and I imagine any similar stove putting out a similar number of BTU's will work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the rest of the week the coffee was perfect.
customer_reviews.text: The arm that allows you to remove the put during brewing doesn't work very well and can cause overflowing if you don't close the basket and then put the pot in place. I wedged part of a plastic fork under the basket above the arm to hold it open. the rest of the week the coffee was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Raeside

customer_reviews.title: best camping equipment ever.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, first time I saw this being used by a friend, I said to myself, " I got to get one of those, for real". I bought it and used it camping several times this summer and it was awesome!!! My friends were all jealous and several have gone out and bought one for themselves. Way to go Coleman !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tie Dye John

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: My friend has one and has used for many years. Thought I would get one too...really wished I didn't. Seems like the quality has falling way down! Plastic lifted and separated first go. I read the bad reviews and thought that I knew better...sorry I did. The Coleman brand is not what it once was.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I love using this for coffee while out ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I love using this for coffee while out camping. My only reason for not giving it 5 stars is that the first time I used it, the "auto pause" switch wasn't seating itself correctly, so my first pot of coffee had it locked "open" and the basket filled and overflowed, made a HUGE mess. Once I made a minor modification to it, it works perfectly now. Brews 6-8 cups in less than 10 minutes, but again... you don't have to wait if you don't want to! :)
customer_reviews.author: T. Kiser

customer_reviews.title: Highly reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Our new favorite camping coffee pot. Takes about 30 minutes to brew full pot. We always have ours full of water and coffee grounds the night before which makes it easier to get the coffe going out in the woods!
customer_reviews.author: butterfly86

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: We use this in our Camper on the stove to make a delicious cup of hot coffee in about 12 minutes. Aside from not being able to keep the carafe warm, this thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: great idea
customer_reviews.text: got this and my top cracked, so now steam comes out. I like the idea of going on gas burner for camping, I put paper filter in so clean up is a snap. Makes ok cup of coffee for camping with other people, but when its just me coffee press is the best
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: for a good cup of coffee or just for clean water.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of three reasons: one -- because it does not require additional fuel, (I like versatility in my camping gear.) two -- it works pretty much like all the other coffee makers I've had over the years. three -- if you ever need safe water to drink, you can distill your water through this coffee maker and know most, if not all, of the things you wanted to get out of the water, chemicals, bacteria, etc, were left behind in the coffee maker boiling chamber(the water reservoir. you'll just have to scrub it out more often.)
customer_reviews.author: Alfred "Jake" King

customer_reviews.title: Love this camping coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Love this camping coffee maker! You can't go wrong with coleman! Whether we take this camping and have real coffee, not perkalater mud filled with grounds, or use it on the camp stove at home when the power goes out, this coffeemaker works great! Takes a minute to heat up and get going, but then it brews the whole pot nicely! I love love love it! if I ever need a replacement, I am ordering this again!
customer_reviews.author: ermommy3

customer_reviews.title: I think this coffee maker is great for what it does
customer_reviews.text: I think this coffee maker is great for what it does. Coffee stays hot longer than in a French press... the only con for me is that it takes a LONG time to brew. It drips really slowly. If you're like me and you need your coffee to not be a big grumpy pants in the morning, this takes longer than I'd like, but stays warm longer than French press and once done, holds more coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Erin M. Coyne

customer_reviews.title: Camp Coffee done right
customer_reviews.text: If you are like me and NEED your morning coffee, this is the camping coffee pot for you. Works just like a normal drip machine. Camp Coffee without the grounds in your teeth. One comment is that it is very slow to run a full pot full. I have not timed it, but it takes more than 30 minutes on my campers cook stove. One nice thing is that you can have the grounds and water ready on the burner, roll out of bed to turn on the burner. by the time the coffee is ready your camper is nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Jrwar15

customer_reviews.title: We have found these Coleman coffee makers reliable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Over the last decade we have owned four of these coffee makers. We go group camping several times a year and have at times kept 20 or more people supplied with their morning coffee by using two of these at a time. Makes up to 12 cups of drip coffee in 15 minutes. We have found these Coleman coffee makers reliable and easy to use. Sure they wear out as will anything but having to replace one every 3-4 years is no hardship and is commendable under their conditions of heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Kevin

customer_reviews.title: This coffee makes works great. We've used it on the outdoor camp stove ...
customer_reviews.text: This coffee makes works great. We've used it on the outdoor camp stove as well As on a burner in our RV. It's a little slow, but I suppose you shouldn't be in a rush while camping anyway. Also be sure that the carafe is pushed all the way in, we had a little mishap the first time using it because it wasn't in all the way and water ended up over flowing out of the top.
customer_reviews.author: MIchelle McCoy

customer_reviews.title: This makes coffee
customer_reviews.text: It is was bigger than I expected. It does make coffee which in the middle of nowhere is a huge plus, but it takes forever.the base sucks for any single burner stove.
customer_reviews.author: RickW2007

customer_reviews.title: Nice when boondocking
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for the camp trailer, don’t need to fire up the generator. Takes a lot longer to brew than expected(10-20 minutes). Get it ready the night before, kick on the burners first thing in the morning, then get dressed(and other assorted morning essentials)... you might have a cup ready when you’re done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: He loves it and it makes good coffee! He was trying to make coffee for ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for christmas. He melted his last one by putting it on to big of flame. He learned his lesson. He loves it and it makes good coffee! He was trying to make coffee for 21 people while out camping with a group and trying to keep up with the demand, turned the camp stove flame all the way up and melted it. Other than that its a perfect coffee pot!
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Never worked, would not fill the pot just dropped then burned.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Coleman does it again.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a big fan of Coleman products and they really nailed it with this coffee maker. Huge hit every trip I take it on.
customer_reviews.author: TheFatElectrician

customer_reviews.title: I hope my new one works just as good as the first
customer_reviews.text: This is now the second one of these I have owned. The first one lasted me right around 10 years with 25-30 uses a year. I hope my new one works just as good as the first. The only negative I have about this coffee maker is that it takes 25-30 minutes to brew a whole pot. The instructions say 15 minutes but I have yet to have a pot come even close to that
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best coffee maker for camping I've used several different types ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best coffee maker for camping I've used several different types over the years and I love this far better then any others I have used. So easy to use set up your coffee in the basket fillers the water resivuare lite your stove and let it perk. You can also use this in your home on a gas stove when the power goes out. Best deal around
customer_reviews.author: Kim Peltier

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Use every camping trip with out starting the generator. Makes enough coffee for everyone to have a cup. I had to return my first one do to the filter try having a crack from the factory. Haven’t had a single issue with the second one. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Coffe anyone?
customer_reviews.text: Coffee is up in no time. Place on the camp stove burner and that's it. Follow the directions and keep handle pointing out.
customer_reviews.author: Mascar Nana

customer_reviews.title: Coleman Camping Coffee Maker made us happy
customer_reviews.text: When we went from a toy hauler to a more comfortable trailer for camping it didn't come with a generator. Since we make coffee for our whole camping group we picked up the Coleman Camping Coffee Maker to use on the stove to replace the Mr. Coffee we used to turn the generator to use. It worked beautifully! It heated the water up quickly, so it was just as fast as the plug-in drip coffee maker. It's lightweight and easy to store. I would recommend this to anyone who really enjoys their coffee when they're camping but hates percolators.
customer_reviews.author: Kixxit

customer_reviews.title: So you like camping coffee...
customer_reviews.text: Hubby loved it no more perk coffee camping. He only wished it had a Warmer like the one at home. Next time we will take a thermos too. Really only flaw was we didn't hear if these earlier
customer_reviews.author: Darni C.

customer_reviews.title: 2 attempts. 2 fails. Done.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't able to successfully get a full pot of coffee. Water would pool and not filter properly. Thankfully bought the Coleman 12 cup stainless steel percolater and used for the duration of our trip. Disappointed with this purchase and will never use again. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Moynahan

customer_reviews.title: camp is much better now
customer_reviews.text: Put this in a cabin up in Berlin NH, the cabin has solar only and a gas stove. We were using percolator type but never got consistent coffee. This thing is a snap, works like a plug in dripped quick and can take coffee with out it leaking during coffee being made. I think the issue with others speed has to do with flame under unit ..... big flame fast drip, small flame slow drip, make sense? Biggest issue is must remember to turn flame of when the brewing is done !!! We have not made the mistake yet.
customer_reviews.author: fish36

customer_reviews.title: Don't like
customer_reviews.text: No quicker than a perk coffee maker and doesn't keep the coffee hot
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: It works good but it does take a while to make the coffee . You do need to start the stove first then put the coffee maker on the burner not much room to get the lighter into the burner to start it up. Cleaning the pot and basket easy but the resevoir is a little more challenging.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly bereswill

customer_reviews.title: it's still better than a percolator so I'll keep using it
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it was the grind of my coffee or the coffee maker but the water wasn't draining through the coffee and filter very well. It seemed to be backing up in the tray the coffee is held in. Also the door to the coffee tray kept popping open. Having said that, it's still better than a percolator so I'll keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: It blew the seal!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my coffee maker in July for Labor Day weekend. After carefully reading and following instructions, we made three pots of coffee before the seal blew and leaked everywhere. Now my return window has closed and I’m stuck with a non-functioning coffee pot. I’m so disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made pretty good coffee and perfect for camping but read the ...
customer_reviews.text: Made pretty good coffee and perfect for camping but read the instructions. Make sure that you have the handle facing out as in the picture or the coffee will spill all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Water Bob

customer_reviews.title: Clever design that really works
customer_reviews.text: The coffee maker works well. We use it when we are boon docking. It takes a bit longer than an electric coffee maker but quicker than a percolator and It is much easier to clean. The first cup is nice and hot but I have to heat up the coffee for my second cup as you cannot leave the burner on. We were surprised it works so well. It is large and takes up most of the stove top area and it needs to cool down before it can be moved I am happy with it and I enjoy my coffee.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: We've had one of these coffee makers for about 10 - years. It worked like a charm until it stopped working. ordered another but this one barely works. Takes forever to brew a pot. Tried running cleaner through it to no avail. NOt sure what they did to make a great coffee maker into a horrible coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: pete

product_meta.title: Coleman Camping Coffee Maker
product_meta.description:
Easily make drip-brewed coffee while enjoying the outdoors with the Coleman Camping Coffee Maker. Designed with a steel base that fits over most 2- and 3-burner camp stoves, this camping coffee maker features a large reservoir that enables you to brew up to 10 cups of hot coffee at once. Making coffee with this outdoor coffee maker is easy. Simply spoon grounds into the removable swing-out filter basket, fill the reservoir with water, and place the coffee maker over your stove burner. Within minutes, the 10-cup glass carafe will be filled with freshly brewed coffee ready to be enjoyed in the great outdoors. A Pause 'N Serve feature lets you grab a cup before the brew cycle is finished. The Coleman Camping Coffee Maker measures 8.5 x 11 x 14 inches.

AMAZON.COM
About Coleman More than 100 years ago, a young man with an entrepreneurial spirit and a better idea began manufacturing lanterns in Wichita, Kansas. His name was W.C. Coleman, and the company he founded would change life in America. A man plagued with such poor vision he sometimes had to ask classmates to read aloud to him, Coleman saw a brilliant light in 1900 in a drugstore window that stopped him in his tracks. He inquired about the light inside and discovered he was able to read even the small print on a medicine bottle by the illumination. The lamps had mantles, not wicks, and were fueled by gasoline under pressure instead of coal oil. Soon afterward, Coleman started a lighting service that offered a "no light, no pay" clause--a big step forward for merchants who were burned by inferior products that rarely worked--and drew substantial interest from businesses that wanted to keep their lights on after dark. In the ensuing years, Coleman expanded its product line well beyond lanterns. The company's current catalog is thick with products that make spending time outdoors a pleasure. There are coolers that keep food and drinks cold for days on end, comfortable airbeds that won't deflate during the night, a complete line of LED lights that last for years, powerful portable grills that cook with an authentic open-grill flame, and much, much more. Coleman has truly fashioned much of our outdoor camping experience, and expects to do so for generations to come. END
feature_bullets: Camping coffee maker quickly brews up to 10 cups of coffee on a camp stove
Steel base fits on most traditional 2- and 3-burner camp stoves
Included 10-cup glass carafe allows for easy pouring
Removable swing-out filter basket fits 8- to 12-cup filters
Pause ‘N Serve feature lets you pour a cup before brew cycle is complete
